entries.title: Sword of the Demon Hunter

review.en: Another fantastic episode. Real and foster father and son relationship is intricatelly woven and dipicted through a piece of picture of a mysterious woman. As all other episode, voice actors for this anime have been doing amaizing jobs. Chances are I'd love to check out the original work. Lots of gratitude for this amazing work.

ã€å··ã«è¿‘é ƒå‡ºå›ã£ã¦ã„ã‚‹æµ®ä¸–çµµãŒå‘ªã„ã‚„é¬¼ã«çµ¡ã‚“ã ã‚‚ã®ã§æ­»äººã‚‚å‡ºã¦ã„ã‚‹ã¨ã®ã“ã¨ã§ä¾é ¼ã‚’å—ã‘ãŸã‚¸ãƒ³ãƒ¤ã€ãã“ã‹ã‚‰çµµå¸«ã®å±…å ´æ‰€ã‚’çªãæ­¢ã‚è¨ªã­ãŸã¨ã“ã‚ã‹ã‚‰ä»¥å¤–ãªç¸ã§è‚²ã¦ã®é¤Šçˆ¶ã€å…ƒæ²»ã®äººã¨ãªã‚Šã€å«ã«å¯¾ã™ã‚‹æƒ³ã„ã€ã¾ãŸè‡ªåˆ†ã¨å¦¹ã‚’å¼•ãå–ã£ãŸå½“æ™‚ã®æ§˜å­ãªã©ã‚‚çŸ¥ã‚‹ã“ã¨ã«ãªã‚‹ã€‚ãã—ã¦é¤Šçˆ¶ãªã®ã«ã™ã£ã‹ã‚Šã„ã‚ã„ã‚ãªéƒ¨åˆ†ã‚’å¼•ç¶™ã„ã§ã„ã‚‹ã“ã¨ãªã©ã‚‚æ°—ã¥ã‹ã•ã‚Œã‚‹ã“ã¨ã«ã‚‚ãªã‚‹ã€‚ã¾ãŸãã®ä¾é ¼ã®çµæœã‚’ä¼ãˆã«å®Ÿéš›ã®ï¼ˆèº«å…ƒã¯æ˜ã‹ã—ã¦ãªã„ãŒãŠäº’ã„ã«ã‚ã‹ã‚Šãã£ã¦ã„ã‚‹ï¼‰çˆ¶ã¨ã®é…’ã‚’èº±ã™ã“ã¨ã«ãªã‚‹ã€‚ãã®éš›ã«ã‹ã¤ã¦ã¨ã¯é•ã„ãŠäº’ã„ã«çŸ¥ã‚Šå¾—ãªã‹ã£ãŸãŠäº’ã„ã®æƒ³ã„ãªã©ã‚‚å¯Ÿã—ãªãŒã‚‰æœˆã‚’è‚´ã«å…±ã«é…’ã‚’äº¤ã‚ã—ã¾ãŸæ¬¡å›ã®ç´„æŸã‚‚èº±ã™äºŒäººã§ã‚ã£ãŸãƒ»ãƒ»ãƒ»ã€‚ã¾ã‚ãªã‚“ã¨ã‚‚ç¾ã—ãæ·±ãæŠ˜ã‚Šé‡ãªã£ãŸäººã¨äººã€è¦ªã¨å­ãã‚ŒãŒè¡€ãŒã¤ãªãŒã£ã¦ã„ã¦ã‚‚ã„ãªãã¦ã‚‚å—ã‘ç¶™ãŒã‚Œã‚‹ã‚‚ã®ã‚‚ã‚ã‚Œã°ç›´æ¥çš„ã«ã¯ãªã‹ãªã‹ã‚ã‹ã‚‰ãªã„ã‚‚ã®ã‚‚ã‚ã£ãŸã‚Šæ™‚æœŸãŒæ­£ã—ããªã‘ã‚Œã°åˆ†ã‹ã‚ã†ã¨å‡ºæ¥ãªã„ã€ã—ã‚ˆã†ã¨ã™ã‚‰ã—ãªã„ã“ã¨ã‚‚ã‚ã‚‹ã®ã ã¨ã€ã€ã€ãã‚Œã§ã‚‚ã‚„ã¯ã‚Šè¦ªå­ãªã‚“ã ã¨ã„ã†ã“ã¨ãŒè¦‹äº‹ã«ç¹Šç´°ã«æã‹ã‚ŒãŸï¼ˆæµ®ä¸–çµµãªã ã‘ã«ï¼‰ç´ æ™´ã‚‰ã—ã„å›ã ã£ãŸã€‚ãã“ã«è•éº¦å±‹ã®ãŠãµã†ã¨åº—ä¸»ã®è¦ªå­é–¢ä¿‚ã‚‚é–¢ã‚ã£ã¦ã„ã¦ä½•ã‚‚è¨€ã†ã“ã¨ã®ãªã„æœ€é«˜ã®å›ãŒå†ã³ã¨ã„ã†æ„Ÿã˜ã§ã—ãŸã€‚åŸä½œã‚‚ç´ æ™´ã‚‰ã—ã„ã®ã§ã—ã‚‡ã†ã­ã€‚æ©Ÿä¼šãŒã‚ã‚Œã°ãœã²è¦‹ã¦ã¿ãŸã„ã€‚ã¾ãŸæœ¬ä½œã®å£°å„ªã•ã‚“ãŸã¡ã®æ¼”æŠ€ãŒæœ¬å½“ã«æ¸‹ã„ã—ç´ æ™´ã‚‰ã—ã„ã€‚ä»Šå›ã®çµµå¸«ã•ã‚“ã®æ¼”æŠ€ã‚‚çˆ¶è¦ªã‚‚å…ƒæ²»ã‚‚åº—ä¸»ã‚‚æœ€é«˜ã ã£ãŸã€‚æ˜¯éã“ã®ã¾ã¾é ‘å¼µã£ã¦ã»ã—ã„ã¨æ€ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚ã‚ã‚ŠãŒã¨ã†ã”ã–ã„ã¾ã—ãŸã€‚ã€ãƒ¼9ç‚¹ãƒ»è¦–è´ç¶™ç¶š

entries.synopsis: In the Edo period, there was a shrine maiden called "Itsukihime" in the mountain village of Kadono. Jinta, a young man who acts as the shrine maiden's guardian despite being a stranger, encounters a mysterious demon who speaks of the far future in the forest where he went to defeat it. From Edo to the Heisei era, this huge Japanese fantasy series follows a demon man who travels through time while continuously questioning the meaning of wielding a sword.

entries.title: Shoshimin: How to Become Ordinary 2

review.en: "Brilliantly constructedâ€”æ —ãã‚“ã¨ã‚“ as a metaphor hits perfectly. The pairing contrasts (Osanai/Kobato vs. Urino/Nakamaru) were clever, painful, and intentional. The resolution was elegant, even chilling. It deserved 10, but 9 feels honestâ€”for now."ğŸ¬ The Case of the Chestnut Sweets (ShÅshimin Series â€“ Ep 7)CW / 9pt â€“ Weekly Rank: #2The chestnut incident reaches its conclusionâ€”and what a well-crafted episode it was.While the scene where Kobato and Osanai "get back together" (or perhaps begin dating for the first time?) felt slightly forced, and the deduction sequence overly prolonged at times, nearly everything else landed beautifully.From the investigation's narrowing process to the clever use of Itsukaichi, and the planted details in Monthly Funado, the structure was impressively deliberate.Even though many viewers could tell that Osanai's actionsâ€”her phone call, the date error, the bookstore receiptâ€”were meant to mislead, it was Kobato's recognition of why they were done (as part of a quiet revenge) that elevated the mystery. That emotional insight was signature Kobato.The portrayal of Urino, on the other hand, was almost pitiful in its precision.Overconfident and performatively mature, he projected strength while overcompensating for insecurity. His attempt to kiss Osanaiâ€”someone he misunderstood completelyâ€”became the exact catalyst for her revenge. Her terrifying expression when she dropped that receipt remains burned in memory, making the motive painfully clear and all the more chilling.This episode wasn't just about solving a mysteryâ€”it was about the gradual reintegration of Kobato and Osanai. The kuri kinton itself becomes a metaphor: strained, blended, held together only by the subtle moisture of the chestnut paste (Osanai), until the two are finally shaped into oneâ€”a perfect tea sweet.The contrast with Urino and Nakamaru was equally intentional.Physically, emotionally, and socially, their dynamics mirror Kobato and Osanai, yet in fragmented, mismatched ways. While both girls hide their complexity, only Osanai's intentions find a true counterpart. Nakamaru's shallow provocation, masked as breakup revenge, reflects her realization that Kobato would never fully engage, his heart still tethered to Osanai.That final comparisonâ€”between a perfectly paired kuri kinton and a cold, failed dish of mismatched ingredientsâ€”summed up everything.It wasn't just the conclusion of a case; it was a symbolic act of emotional resolution, unspoken reconciliation, and the quiet restoration of balance.This was a masterfully structured arc.Though I hesitated to give it a full 10, only because the emotional payoff could have been extended slightly, it remains an exceptionally strong 9.

entries.synopsis: The second season will focus on two new cases from the novel series, adapting the two-part third volume Shuuki Gentei Kuri Kinton Jiken (The Autumn-Exclusive Kuri Kinton Case) and the fifth volume Touki Gentei Bonbon Chocolat Jiken (The Winter-Exclusive Chocolate Bonbons Case).

entries.title: Me and the Alien MuMu
entries.synopsis: A cat-like alien from a distant galaxy, MuMu, arrives on Earth. His goal is to learn about home appliance technology on Earth to recover the technology his species has lost. The protagonist, Sakurako, has a typical university life, but everything changes with MuMu's arrival! What begins as an unexpected cohabitation quickly turns into a whirlwind of chaotic events. The chemistry between Sakurako and MuMu leads to a super-spectacular, appliance-filled, and cat comedy adventure.

entries.title: Witch Watch

review.en: Still suspended; This episode was fun and well-structured and unlike other episodes, with much less parodies - quite impressive. Possibly coming back in the active watch pool, it all depends on the next episode. Personally, just wanna enjoy the show without rating or reviewing though. - 9pt.

entries.synopsis: Morihito Otogi, a high school student who comes from a lineage of ogres, enjoys a peaceful, ordinary life until his childhood friend, Nico, moves in with him. Nico is a witch-in-training, and chooses Morihito to be her familiar. While Nico is thrilled to reunite with her old friend and crush, Morihito is tasked with the perilous duty to protect her from a foretold calamity. Between the unpredictable chaos caused by Nicoâ€™s magic, and the awkwardness of sharing a home, their lives become a whirlwind of supernatural hijinks and threats.

entries.title: Apocalypse Hotel

review.en: Just brilliant. Wowâ€¦lost words. Even 9.2point feels too low, but I had to hold back. Just for Ranking purposes. All I can say is: this is the Weekly Ranking. Period." I could give any score to this episode though. I won't even get into the content this time.

entries.synopsis: Following the collapse of civilization, one storied hotel stands among the ruins of Tokyoâ€™s Ginza district. Overrun by nature, this lone hotel continues to defy humanityâ€™s collapse. Current guests: zero. Check-ins scheduled today: zero. Yesterdayâ€™s website traffic: zero. Enter with caution in this story of survival and mystery in a world where the memory of humanity begins to fade.

entries.title: Your Forma

review.en:
Still watching, but barely holding on

The story's got potential. The arc or this episode wasn't bad at all.But the pacing? The structure? The visuals? Still a mess.

Honestly, it's frustratingâ€”so many scenes feel rushed, underexplained, or just plain sloppy.The animation's inconsistent, especially anyone who's not Luke-Lat. Hieda might be one of the least engaging characters I've seen in a while. Cold, flat, and barely present as a personality.

And seriouslyâ€”her house gets destroyed, but the cat's fine?No one checks on the house, just the cat. Then suddenly the cat's at work too?Who took care of it? Why is nobody asking questions?

Alsoâ€¦ post-explosion? Her boss? Where'd she go? Did they even mention the cat's fate?The E follower yelling "Fireworks!" before attacking Hiedaâ€”why didn't anyone find that suspicious?And that "conveniently timed" moment where a teammate opens the door right as she's being attacked? Way too staged. Like, that's the only shot we get of him.

Then there's Luke-Lat's current partnerâ€”he disappears after the explosion. Just gone.And the cartridge girl calls exactly when needed? And no one questions the cartridges themselves? Come on.It's not that the ideas are badâ€”it's the lack of buildup.Moments don't land because nothing's earned.It all adds up to a ton of small irritations that just keep pulling you out of it.Stillâ€¦ I gotta admit, I enjoyed it enough to give it an 8.That's what makes it even more frustratingâ€”this show could really be something if it just tightened up.

entries.synopsis: In 1992, a pandemic of viral encephalitis shook the world. The medical technology that saved humanity evolved into â€œYour Formaâ€â€”an invasive information device implanted into the brain. In this world where every sight, sound, and even emotion is recorded, investigating major crimes means diving into the collective data, a job reserved for special detectives called â€œElectronic Investigator.â€  Echika Hieda, a prodigious â€œElectronic Investigatorâ€ assigned at an astonishingly young age, stands isolated by her exceptional talent. Her newly assigned partner is Harold, a blonde, blue-eyed humanoid â€œAmicus.â€ Together, this unrivaled duo will expose every hidden secret.

entries.title: From Old Country Bumpkin to Master Swordsman

review.en: Pure, unapologetic boredom, plain and simpleâ€”nothing more.  Could drop from the watchlist any second. Or Basically dangling outside the active lineup.

entries.romanized_title: Katainaka no Ossan, Kensei ni Naru
entries.synopsis: Beryl Gardinant, a self-proclaimed â€œhumble old man,â€ is a sword instructor at his dojo in a rural, backwater village. In his younger years, he dreamed of glory as a master swordsman, but those days are long behind him. Out of the blue, he receives a visit from a famous former pupil who brings him world-shattering newsâ€”he's been appointed as special instructor for the knights of the Liberion Order! With his life now turned upside down, Beryl travels to the capital and reunites with some of his former students: elite knights, an ace wizard, and even an adventurer who's attained the highest guild rank possible. But why do they all want his tutelage?! As far as he's concerned, they clearly don't need him anymore.

entries.title: Summer Pockets

review.en: I honestly don't know why I'm still rating and reviewing thisâ€”it's awful and already off the list.The pace was painfully slow until the previous episode, and now suddenly everything got jammed into this one.Turns out they're doing one girl's route every six episodes, and this one was Kamome's.It's the typical dating sim formula, just poorly executed.Honestly, it was a messâ€¦ but Kamome was cute. I'll give it that.

entries.synopsis: Takahara Hairi never expected summer to feel like a dream. Sent to Torishirojima Island to sort through his late grandmotherâ€™s belongings, heâ€™s met with endless sea, quiet nostalgia, and mysterious girls, each chasing something just out of reach. As he settles into island life, lost memories begin to surface and he finds what he never knew heâ€™d lost.
